Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1EMa (Gaegurin-5, Gaegurin 5, GGN5, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, Korean wrinkled frogRana rugosa, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against M. luteus (MIC 2.5 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 10 ug/ml), B. subtilis (MIC 10 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 50 ug/ml), S. dysentariae (MIC 50 ug/ml), P. putida (MIC 50 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 100 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 75 ug/ml), S. cerevisiae (MIC 50 ug/ml), C. albicans (MIC 50 ug/ml).   Also inhibits the growth of filamentous fungus A. nidulans. It also ruptured protozoan A. proteus at 25 ug/ml in a few minutes.Toxicity: Poor hemolysis (1.0%) at 100 ug/ml (hemo.lytic).  Name updated 2/2010. MIC updated 5/2020; 7/2021; formatted 9/2024
Literature Information.Author: Park JM, Jung J-E, Lee BJ.1994
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
